item.title: 独家消息消息人士称中国买家对德国大众无用工厂感兴趣
item.description: 一位了解中国政府想法的人士告诉路透社，中国官员和汽车制造商正在关注即将关闭的德国工厂，尤其对大众汽车的厂址感兴趣。【原文：Chinese officials and automakers are eyeing German factories slated for closure and are particularly interested in Volkswagen's sites , a person with knowledge of Chinese government thinking told Reuters.】

item.title: 据《纽约时报》报道，TikTok 首席执行官计划出席特朗普就职典礼
item.description: 据《纽约时报》周三援引两位熟悉该计划的人士的话报道，TikTok 的首席执行官计划出席美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的就职典礼。【原文：The chief executive of TikTok plans to attend U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration, the New York Times reported on Wednesday, citing two people familiar with the plans.】

item.title: REDD 报道：在市场低迷之际，中国万科没有延长债券期限的计划
item.description: 据财经媒体 REDD 援引两位知情人士的话报道，房地产开发商中国万科周三告诉一些投资者，在市场抛售之际，该公司没有计划延长债券期限。【原文：Property developer China Vanke told some investors on Wednesday that it had no plans to extend its bonds amid a market sell-off, financial news outlet REDD reported, citing two persons briefed by the company on the matter.】

item.title: 日本央行将于 3 月底加息，多数分析师倾向于 1 月加息
item.description: 路透社调查的绝大多数经济学家表示，日本央行将在本季度的两次会议中的一次会议上再次加息至 0.50%，大多数人倾向于在 1 月份加息。【原文：The Bank of Japan will raise interest rates again at one of the two meetings this quarter to 0.50%, an overwhelming majority of economists surveyed by Reuters said, with most leaning toward a January move.】

item.title: 据美国全国广播公司（NBC）报道，随着禁令临近，美国正在权衡让 TikTok 继续运营的方案
item.description: 美国全国广播公司（NBC）周三晚些时候援引三位熟悉讨论情况的人士的话报道，拜登政府正在探索如何在禁令将于周日生效的情况下仍能让美国人访问 TikTok。【原文：The Biden administration is exploring ways to keep TikTok accessible in the United States even as a ban is set to take effect on Sunday, NBC News reported late on Wednesday, citing three people familiar with the discussions.】

item.title: 特朗普的美国财政部人选贝森特称美元必须继续作为世界储备货币
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）选择的财政部负责人斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周三在阐述 "新经济黄金时代 "的愿景时，誓言要确保美元继续作为世界储备货币。【原文：Scott Bessent, U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's choice to head the Treasury Department, on Wednesday vowed to ensure that the dollar remains the world's reserve currency as he laid out a vision for a "new economic golden age".】

item.title: 美国通胀缓解打压美元，日元在日本央行会议前上涨
item.description: 由于美国通胀数据降温导致债券收益率下降，美元汇率周四下滑至略低于近期高点的水平，而日元则因对日本加息的押注上升而创下一个月来的新高。【原文：The dollar slipped on Thursday to stand just off recent peaks as cooling U.S. inflation data knocked down bond yields, while the yen hit a one-month high on rising bets on a rate hike in Japan.】

item.title: 2024 年新加坡船用燃料枢纽的船用燃料销售额创历史新高
item.description: 官方数据周三显示，受创纪录的集装箱吞吐量和替代船用燃料交付量增加的推动，全球最大的船用燃料枢纽新加坡的船用燃料销售量在2024年达到新高。【原文：Marine fuel sales reached fresh highs at the world's largest bunker hub of Singapore in 2024, official data showed on Wednesday, driven by record container throughput and higher deliveries of alternative marine fuels.】

item.title: 美国库存下降加剧供应担忧，石油上涨
item.description: 美国原油库存降幅大于预期，加剧了美国对俄罗斯能源贸易制裁引发的供应担忧，油价周四连续第二天上涨。【原文：Oil prices rose for a second day on Thursday after a larger-than-expected decline in U.S. crude oil stockpiles added to supply concerns stoked by U.S. sanctions against Russian energy trade.】

item.title: 阿根廷将改革反倾销制度以促进竞争
item.description: 阿根廷经济部长路易斯-卡普托（Luis Caputo）周三在社交媒体上表示，阿根廷将对本国的反倾销制度进行改革，以促进竞争和降低价格。【原文：Argentina will roll out changes to the country's anti-dumping system in an effort to promote greater competition and bring down prices, Economy Minister Luis Caputo said on social media on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国称丰田公司将认罪并支付逾 16 亿美元以了结欺诈计划
item.description: 美国司法部周三在一份声明中表示，丰田汽车公司的一个部门同意认罪，并在与美国政府机构达成的和解协议中支付超过16亿美元，以解决与排放欺诈计划有关的违规行为。【原文：A Toyota Motor Corp unit agreed to plead guilty and pay over $1.6 billion in a settlement with U.S. government agencies to settle violations related to an emissions fraud scheme, the U.S. Justice Department said in a statement on Wednesday.】

item.title: 耶伦称特朗普的新税收机构计划不会为纳税人省钱
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周三表示，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）计划成立一个新的政府机构来征收关税，这将与现有机构重复，而且不太可能节省开支。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Wednesday U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's plan to set up a new government agency to collect tariffs would duplicate an existing agency and was unlikely to save money.】

item.title: Canalys 称第四季度中国苹果智能手机出货量下降 25
item.description: 研究公司 Canalys 周四的数据显示，第四季度苹果智能手机在中国的出货量下降了 25%，而华为则增长了 24%。【原文：Apple smartphone shipments in China fell 25% in the fourth quarter, while Huawei's rose 24%, data from research firm Canalys showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 12 月就业人数超预期，失业率上升
item.description: 由于兼职工作激增，澳大利亚 12 月份的就业率超过了预期。【原文：Australian employment sped past forecasts in December thanks to a surge in part-time jobs, though the jobless rate ticked higher as more people went looking for work.】

item.title: 诺华输掉在美国阻止恩曲斯托仿制药上市的紧急竞标
item.description: 华盛顿特区的一名联邦法官周三拒绝了诺华公司在第十一小时内提出的阻止制药商 MSN 制药公司推出诺华公司的心脏衰竭特效药 Entresto 的仿制药的请求。【原文：A Washington, D.C. federal judge on Wednesday refused Novartis' eleventh-hour bid to block drugmaker MSN Pharmaceuticals from launching a generic version of Novartis' blockbuster heart-failure drug Entresto.】

item.title: 阿克曼的潘兴广场公司要求 UMG 将第二上市地迁至美国
item.description: 环球音乐集团（Universal Music Group）周三表示，亿万富翁比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）领导的潘兴广场公司（Pershing Square）已行使权利，要求该唱片公司在美国发行股票并二次上市。【原文：Universal Music Group said on Wednesday that billionaire Bill Ackman-led Pershing Square has exercised its right to request an offering and secondary listing of the record label in the United States.】

item.title: 消息人士称加拿大可能对价值 1,500 亿加元的美国进口商品征收关税
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的消息人士周三表示，如果美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普对加拿大商品和服务征收关税，加拿大可能会对价值高达1500亿加元的美国进口商品采取反制措施。【原文：Canada could impose countermeasures on up to C$150 billion worth of U.S. imports if President-elect Donald Trump puts tariffs on Canadian goods and services, a source familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 调查显示：日本企业面临人口老龄化带来的严重劳动力危机
item.description: 路透社周四的一项调查显示，由于日本人口持续萎缩并迅速老龄化，三分之二的日本公司正在经受工人短缺对业务造成的严重影响。【原文：Two-thirds of Japanese companies are experiencing a serious business impact from a shortage of workers, a Reuters survey showed on Thursday, as the country's population continues to shrink and age rapidly.】

item.title: Bytedance 挥舞 "白旗"，美国 TikTok 用户陷入混乱和绝望
item.description: 周三，美国 TikTok 用户在得知中国公司字节跳动计划在周日之前关闭其 1.7 亿美国用户使用的应用程序的消息后，失望、否认和困惑涌上心头。【原文：Disappointment, denial and confusion flooded U.S. TikTok on Wednesday upon hearing the news that Chinese owner ByteDance planned to shut off the app for its 170 million U.S. users by Sunday, seemingly throwing in the towel on efforts to keep the popular video-sharing platform going.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，苹果公司正与巴克莱银行和同步银行谈判，以取代高盛集团的信用卡交易
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士称，苹果公司正在与巴克莱银行谈判，以取代高盛成为这家科技巨头的信用卡合作伙伴。【原文：Apple is in talks with Barclays to replace Goldman Sachs as the tech giant's credit card partner, said two sources familiar with the matter, as the Wall Street giant steps back from its consumer finance ambitions.】

item.title: Azul 和 Gol 航空公司接近达成潜在合作，组建巴西主要航空公司
item.description: 周三提交的一份证券文件显示，巴西最大的两家航空公司 Azul 和 Gol 正朝着全面合并的目标迈进，合并后将成为拉丁美洲第一大经济体中占主导地位的航空公司。【原文：Azul and Gol , two of Brazil's largest airlines, are moving a step closer to a sweeping merger that would create a dominant carrier in Latin America's No. 1 economy, a securities filing showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 媒体报道称，苹果和谷歌首席执行官将与科技界领袖一起出席特朗普就职典礼
item.description: 据外媒周三报道，苹果公司蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）和谷歌首席执行官桑达尔-皮查伊（Sundar Pichai）等大科技公司领导人计划出席美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普周一的就职典礼。【原文：Apple's Tim Cook and Google CEO Sundar Pichai are among the Big Tech leaders planning to attend U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration on Monday, according to media reports on Wednesday.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，冷库房地产投资信托基金 Lineage 裁员
item.description: 华尔街日报》周二援引公司声明报道，冷藏房地产投资信托公司 Lineage Inc 去年在美国首次发行股票大获成功后，正在裁员。【原文：Cold storage real estate investment trust Lineage Inc is cutting staff after a blockbuster initial stock offering in the U.S. last year, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday, citing a company statement.】

item.title: 人工智能芯片需求强劲，台积电第四季度利润大增
item.description: 台湾中芯国际集成电路制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co , the main global producer of advanced chips used in artificial intelligence applications, is expected to report a 58% leap in fourth-quarter profit on Thursday because of surging demand.】

item.title: 早间投标全球通胀缓解缓解债券收益率阴霾
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 华盛顿邮报》报道：特朗普考虑暂停执行 TikTok 禁令 60 至 90 天
item.description: 华盛顿邮报》周三援引两位熟悉此事的人士的话报道称，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普正在考虑发布一项行政命令，在 60 至 90 天内暂停执行 TikTok 出售或禁令法律。【原文：U.S. President-elect Donald Trump is considering an executive order that would suspend the enforcement of the TikTok sale-or-ban law for 60 to 90 days, the Washington Post reported on Wednesday, citing two people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 杜邦表示不会分离水业务
item.description: 工业材料制造商杜邦公司周三表示，不再打算分离其水业务。【原文：Industrial materials maker DuPont said on Wednesday it no longer intends to separate its water business.】

item.title: 州监管机构对违反反洗钱规定的 Block Inc 罚款 8000 万美元
item.description: 布洛克公司同意向 48 个州的金融监管机构支付 8000 万美元的罚款，原因是其移动支付服务 "现金应用程序 "违反了反洗钱法。【原文：Block, Inc has agreed to pay a fine of $80 million to a group of 48 state financial regulators for violations of anti-money laundering laws through its mobile payment service, Cash App.】

item.title: 洛杉矶商会设立基金帮助受火灾影响的小企业
item.description: 洛杉矶地区商会（Los Angeles Area Chamber of Commerce）周三宣布设立一项救济基金，用于支持和重建受过去一周肆虐洛杉矶部分地区的野火影响的小型企业。【原文：The Los Angeles Area Chamber of Commerce on Wednesday announced the creation of a relief fund to support and rebuild small businesses affected by the wildfires that have ravaged parts of Los Angeles for the past week.】

item.title: 尽管 CPI 推动了市场反弹，但通胀复苏仍是市场风险所在
item.description: 周三，美国消费者物价涨幅相对温和，引发股市和债券大幅松动反弹，但交易员和投资者警告说，市场可能仍对通胀速度感到焦虑。【原文：A relatively benign U.S. reading on consumer price increases triggered a sharp relief rally in stocks and bonds on Wednesday, but traders and investors warn that markets are likely to remain anxious about the pace of inflation.】
